New Records: Spain secured a result with no goals conceded for the first time in a tournament
Key Match Events: Ferran Torres scored the opening goal for Spain
Thomas Strakosha denied Álvaro Morata from close range
David Raya made a superb save from Armando Broja
Joselu headed over from Álex Grimaldo's cross
Mikel Merino sliced his shot over from Álex Grimaldo's cross
Armando Broja almost scored with a shot from inside the box
Robin Le Normand took out Broja as he threatened to race through
Pre-Game Insights: Albania's coach Sylvinho said they would show up and compete, despite being in a tough group with Italy, Croatia, and Spain
Sylvinho mentioned that even Spain's B team could play the final and still be favourites
Post-Match Reflections: Sylvinho was proud of his team's performance and said he wouldn't change the experience for anything
Sylvinho mentioned that the team had come to compete and had done so throughout their 10 days in the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a night when another young fan ran on to the pitch and when the flares may bring another fine for a federation already hit with €84,875 worth of them
Albania were the most international team in the tournament, with players from eight different leagues
